job_description: 2024 Regulatory Engineer Campus Hire Our Regulatory Engineering team thrives on the challenge of operating in a complex global environment. We ensure product compliance to global regulatory, market and customer requirements in all our target regions. We work across segments and functions to integrate policy relating to emissions, safety, RF and the environment into products and solutions. As we align regulatory standards with our strategic plans, we work closely with regulatory bodies, as well as with industry and customer groups. Join us as a Regulatory Engineer on our Regulatory Compliance team in Taipei to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact. What you’ll achieve As a Regulatory Engineer , you will Be responsible for implementation of applicable regulations, standards and global market requirements for electromagnetic compatibility, energy, acoustics, safety, security, accessibility, and/or environmental features relevant to design and fulfillment of Dell Products/Solutions. Assist in identification of regulatory and market access requirements; influence/create regulations & standards; and provide End to End (E2E) Product Life Cycle management solutions to meet our global Regulatory Country Ship to List ( CStL ). Provide guidance to design teams, Original Design Manufacturers (ODMs), Suppliers, 3rd Party Labs, and Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEMs) partners in resolving issues that may arise during the review and evaluation of platform solutions by the various regulatory agencies. Prepare schedules, statements of work and functional plans necessary to obtain required regulatory approvals for platforms and devices. Lead and execute audits to ensure continuous compliance for all Dell’s products and coordinate internal and external stakeholders in terms of ODMs, Suppliers, 3rd Party Labs in resolving issues. Assures that all platforms and solutions are compliant with worldwide regulatory EMC, safety and environmental regulatory agency requirements, specifications and policies. Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Engineering, Electronic Engineering or Electrical Engineering with recent graduation between February 2023 and December 2024 Strong analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use technical data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions. Good project management skills Strong written and verbal communication skills and able to operate in a global environment Desirable Requirements Knowledge/Experience with wireless products or antenna design or relevant global regulatory compliance Risk analysis and management Who we are We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we’re looking for you. Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us.
